questions.question: Why was the plate of gold considered a gift from Heaven?
questions.answer: Because it fell from Heaven with a divine message written on it.

questions.question: What condition was set to receive the plate of gold?
questions.answer: It was to be given to the one who loved God the most.

questions.question: Why did many claimants fail to receive the plate?
questions.answer: Their love was not sincere and selfless.

questions.question: What happened when false claimants touched the plate?
questions.answer: The plate changed into basest lead.

questions.question: Why were beggars gathered outside the temple?
questions.answer: They hoped to receive charity from pilgrims.

questions.question: What mistake did the pilgrims make while giving alms?
questions.answer: They did not show real compassion or concern.

questions.question: What moved the peasant’s heart?
questions.answer: The suffering of a blind and helpless beggar.

questions.question: What did the peasant say to the blind beggar?
questions.answer: He comforted him and asked him to trust God.

questions.question: Why was the peasant chosen by God?
questions.answer: Because his love and kindness were genuine and selfless.

questions.question: What message does the poem convey?
questions.answer: Service to mankind is service to God.
